summary:
9+ years of experience with Information Security Concepts
Expert in Security Assessment, Threat Modeling, Design Review, Risk Assessment and Architectural Review 
Expertise in Microsoft Public Key Infrastructure, Cryptography, Active Directory, Microsoft Certificate Services (stand-alone and AD integrated), Certification Authority (CA), Network Device Enrollment Service (NDES), CEP/CES, OCSP, CRL, and Hashing
Sound Knowledge of industry security concepts / frameworks and regulatory standards such as FIPS140-2, ISO-27001, NIST Framework for Improving Critical Infrastructure Cybersecurity HIPAA, data protection

currentPositions.description:
Handling Product cybersecurity development responsibilities such as assessing the privacy and cybersecurity state of the product, defining the product roadmap features/enhancements with stakeholder approval, performing defect management forcybersecurity issues, and documenting MDS2 & Product and Security Manual
• Owning and delivering GEHC Product Cybersecurity Standard artifacts, in coordination with the PSL, which includes, creating Design Engineering Privacy and Security (DEPS) artifacts for privacy and security risk assessments to engage in domain-specific product threat modelling, attack surface analysis, risk management and reduction, coordinating with the PSL to support the product team in scheduling and performing vulnerability scans and cybersecurity assessments, leading product Security Technical Design Reviews
• Working with the GEHC Product Security team on released product life-cycle, including participating in post-market product vulnerability monitoring to determine product vulnerability impact, investigation, and risk assessment.
currentPositions.title: Cyber Security Engineer

projects.description: The focus of this project is to authenticate The Corporate Employees where an employee can access company documents and policies on mobile through company network. This project is about this tool which takes request from the employee to get a certificate from the CA via NDES. It is created in .Net framework and tested in Windows Server 2012 R2 Environment.
projects.title: Mobile Device Management Software

projects.description: In the recent years, Mobile IPv4 faced many problems related to triangular routing and mobility. Mitigating many issues related to Mobile IPv4, Mobile IPv6 provides the feature of Route Optimization and mobility to Mobile Nodes (MN), which enhances the network performance and solve the mobility related issues. But as a result, it created many security related issues. The primary challenge of Mobile IPv6 is to provide security to end-users. The major contribution of this project is to design a new mitigation scheme for a Binding Drop attack in Mobile IPv6. We created a security framework in C, where we implemented a security algorithm and a key sharing scheme to protect the Binding Messages.
projects.title: Securing Binding Update Messages in Mobile IPv6

projects.description: In this project we performed "Blackhole Attack" for Mobile Ad hoc Network (MANET) Simulations using AODV routing protocol on NS-2. In this attack, adversary node drops all the packets passed through it. In order to do this, the adversary node attracts the neighbor node with false route reply with less hop count and greater sequence number. Once, route is established through that node then the neighbor node starts sending packets and eventually all packets will be dropped at adversary.
projects.title: Blackhole Attack in AODV Protocol ns2

projects.description: The focus of this project is to connect two different labs where one lab is of IPv4 and another is of IPv6 with the help of a Cisco router 2821 and to make them interoperable. It uses Network Address Translation on the router to make this communication happen. Any IPv4 node wants to communicate with the IPv6 node then the router converts the IP from IPv4 to IPv6 & vice versa.
projects.title: Interoperability between IPv4 and IPv6

projects.description: Cryptographic operations for mobile devices has been always challenging. Speed of algorithms, key generation and encryption/decryption time, the cost of the operations, etc. are major key parameters to compare asymmetric cryptography algorithms on mobile devices.
projects.title: Performance Analysis of Asymmetric cryptography for Mobile Devices

projects.description: Autonomous Examination Department is a web application designed for examination department of the college. The main objective of this system is to efficiently evaluate the candidate thoroughly via a fully automated system that not only saves lots of time but also gives fast results. We created a database in MySQL and the designing part was done using HTML and J2EE.
projects.title: Autonomous Examination Department

headline: Product Security | Threat Modeling | Design Assessment | PKI | Cryptography | NITK | AIR 627

message.text:
With this video, I’m launching a national health movement against false marketing in packaged food!

This time I’m not alone. Many influencers, celebrities, doctors and sports stars have UNITED to fight against false marketing!

Every week we hear of a new food issue affecting the country! Infant milk sugar, children’s health drinks, Indian chips having palm oil and the masala-cancer issue are just a few of them.

If the majority of Indians started reading labels, companies would be forced to stop false marketing and give us better quality food!

I invite the entire country to pledge to start reading labels now.

Let us all unite to make India the health capital of the world instead of the diabetes capital of the world!

Label Padhega India, tabhi toh swasth banega India!

Let’s break the internet.

#LabelPadhegaIndia
